A Quantity schedule is when a Product quantity is delivered over time and allows tracking of shipping dates.
What is a Revenue Product Schedule?
Revenue schedules allow tracking of revenue that is not received up front and is paid in installments or by subscriptions.
How do Orders work?

Agreement to supply a quantity of Product or service at a certain 
quantity and date. Created from an Account, Contract or from the order 
tab.
What are the different types of Pricebooks?

Standard and Custom. The standard pricebook can be used if there is one 
price for all customers. If there are multiple prices for different 
customers custom pricebooks can be used.
How can Paths be defined?

A path can be set for each record type of an object. Paths can be 
created for most Standard and all custom objects that have picklists.
What is a reduction order?
Returns, cancellations and reduction in quantity are recorded as reduction orders.
When forecasting by schedule date, which values are used by Salesforce to calculate forecast amounts?
Salesforce uses the values from a product schedule’s Date and Revenue or Quantity fields to calculate forecast amounts.
Which Salesforce feature can be used by sales reps to make and receive calls in Salesforce as well as log call details automatically?
Lightning Dailer
What can be created an run in a Lightning Sales Console to automate repetitive tasks such as updating opportunities and sending an email?
Macro
In Lightning Experience, which type of team can be used if a partner user needs to work with an internal user on a particular opportunity?
Opportunity Team
When using Lightning Dialer, which feature allows sales reps to use a separate business line to make and receive calls?
Call Bridge
Which Lightning Dialer feature can be utilized by sales reps to refer back to important conversations to improve their selling techniques.
Call recording
Which forecast type should be used to enable territory forecasts in Collaborative Forecasting?
Opportunity Revenue by Territory
Which access levels are possible when a forecast manager shares his forecasts page with another user?
'View Only' or 'View and Edit'
Which are territory forecasts based on when a forecast manager is not assigned to a territory?

The territory’s forecasts are based on the individual users assigned to 
the territory. Users can drill down to an individual rep’s forecasts for
 a territory.
Where can an administrator obtain dashboards that show key sales metrics?
AppExchange
Which feature allows identifying high-quality leads based on the company's successful conversion patterns?
Einstein Lead Scoring
Which Sales Cloud Einstein feature can be utilized to assign a score to each opportunity based on record details and related products?
Einstein Opportunity Scoring
Which standard Lightning component can be added to the Home Page to show important updates about leads and opportunities to the current user?
Assistant.
Which feature can be configured to provide a visual representation of opportunity stages with tailored guidance to sales reps?
Path
What can be done to make sure that users don't convert leads to opportunities in Lightning Experience?
The opportunity section in the Convert Lead window can be hidden in 'Lead Settings'.
How can duplicate Leads be idenitifed and managed?
Using the ‘Find Duplicates’ button, fields can be selected to search on, and up to 3 Leads can be merged from the search results
What tools and features are available to manage Leads?
Import Leads, Mass Delete Leads, Transfer Multiple Leads, Mass Email Leads, Mass Add Leads to Campaigns, Mass Change Lead Status
What is Lead Conversion?
A way to convert Leads to linked newly created or existing Contact, Account and Opportunity records.
What is Lead Process?

A group of Lead statuses mapped to a Lead record type. Allows for 
different steps in a Lead life-cycle to be defined for different types 
of Leads.
How can Leads be automatically assigned?

Lead assignment rules can automatically assign Leads to users or queues 
based on criteria matching field values and can be evaluated upon 
creating or editing a Lead.
What are Lead Queues?

Lead Queues are a place to hold Leads that have not been assigned an 
owner. They are accessed via a list view and users with access to the 
queue can ‘accept’ Leads to take ownership.
What needs to be connected to Salesforce to generate Leads from LinkedIn?
A LinkedIn member account with one or more ad accounts
How can Leads be captured from websites and saved in Salesforce?

Web-to-Lead allows Leads to be captured from a company website and saved
 in Salesforce. The Lead form can include standard and custom Lead 
fields. Generated HTML can be added to a public website.
What is Campaign Influence?

One or more campaigns that have influenced an Opportunity linked to an 
Campaign, with one being marked as the primary. Values from the 
primary are used for the campaign statistics.
Which setting can be enabled in Web-to-Lead Settings to reject any bogus leads?
'Require reCAPTCHA Verification'
How can Campaign members be added to a campaign?

Leads and Contacts can be added using a report, list view, from a Lead 
or Contact record, using the import wizard or data loader or using ‘Add 
Member’ button on the campaign.
What is the Campaign Hierarchy?

A way to link related campaigns in a hierarchy of up to 5 levels and 
unlimited siblings. Total fields e.g. total value of Opportunities for 
all campaigns in a hierarchy can be displayed.
How can an email be sent to all members of a campaign in Lightning Experience?
List emails can be sent directly to all members of a campaign in Lightning Experience using 'Send List Email'
What is Campaign ROI and how is it calculated?

Return on investment of a campaign=((Total value of won Opportunities 
linked to a campaign – Actual cost of the campaign) / Actual Cost of the
 campaign) * 100
In Lightning Experience, which feature can be configured to visually track the progress of campaigns?
Path
{{c1::Pipeline}} is all of your Opportunites.
Salesforce offers various features related to activities, such as {{c1::group tasks}}, {{c1::shared activities}}, and {{c1::calendars}}.
The {{c1::Activity Timeline}} displays the next steps and past activity on records of objects such as Account and Opportunity.
A {{c1::Group Task}} can be assigned to multiple users, which creates a separate copy of the task for each user.
{{c1::Shared Activities}} can be enabled. Up to 50 contacts, including a designated primary contact, can be related to a {{c1::shared}} task or event.
{{c1::Calendars}} can be personal or public. Personal {{c1::calendars}} can be shared with users. Public {{c1::calendars}} can be shared with public groups, roles, and users.
A {{c1::Task}} is a to-do item that can have a due date as an option
{{c1::Events}} are scheduled calendar events with a duration.
{{c1::Activities}} can be related to records such as Accounts, Contacts, Cases, and Opportunities, or can be independent as personal task or event.
A Group Task can be assigned up to {{c1::200}} users.
Up to {{c1::50}} contacts can be related to a shared task or event.
The {{c1::primary contact}} is the first name displayed in the ‘Name’ field and followed by the number of other contacts associated to the task.
A user can choose to receive {{c1::email notifications}} when a task is assigned to them
A task can be assigned to a queue and can be completed by any queue member. The queue can be created in Setup under 'Queues', with {{c1::'Task'}} as the supported object
A user can share the {{c1::My Events}} calendar with a manager or other colleagues, but not with personal and public groups
{{c1::Public}} Calendars are used to manage group activities, while {{c2::Resource}} Calendars can be used to schedule the use of shared resources, like a conference room or equipment.
{{c1::Activity Timeline}} displays next steps and past activities on an opportunity, lead, account, contact, contract, and custom objects that have activity enabled.
Salesforce can be integrated with third-party {{c1::email}} and {{c1::calendar}} applications like Microsoft or Google email.
{{c1::Lightning Sync}} can synchronize contacts and events between a Microsoft Exchange-based calendar and Salesforce.
{{c1::Einstein Activity Capture}} can be used to automatically add email and events from user email and calendar applications to the activity timeline of related records.
{{c1::Chatter}} is a native collaboration tool within Salesforce.
A file of up to {{c1::2GB}} can be attached to a post or comment in Chatter
Chatter {{c1::topics}} can be used to collaborate on themes and issues.
Chatter access is available for {{c1::standard}} Salesforce licensed users. Other Chatter-specific licenses offered are {{c2::Chatter External}}, {{c2::Chatter Free}}, and {{c2::Chatter Only}}.
One standard Salesforce license enables up to {{c1::5,000}} Chatter Free licenses
One standard Salesforce license currently enables {{c1::500}} Chatter External licenses.
Chatter Only license is also known as the Chatter {{c1::Plus}} license
{{c1::Lightning Platform}} license includes access to Chatter
Chatter {{c1::Groups}} allow a number of people to collaborate. They can be set to public, private, or unlisted.
Chatter post access is determined by {{c1::record}} or {{c1::group}} access
The {{c1::Salesforce app}} provides access to Salesforce data and functionality and makes it possible for users to use Salesforce on the go.
Salesforce has also made the {{c1::SalesforceA}} app available which allows administrators to access important information and manage users on their mobile devices.
The {{c1::Quip}} app can be used to edit documents and collaborate with coworkers
The {{c1::AppExchange}} is a marketplace for Salesforce and third parties to offer add-ons for a Salesforce org.
There are five types of AppExchange solutions that can be downloaded: {{c1::Apps}}, {{c2::Bolt solutions}}, {{c3::Flow Solutions}}, {{c4::Lightning Data}}, {{c5::Components}}.
Salesforce {{c1::native}} apps are applications that are 100% dependent on and built in the Salesforce platform.
{{c1::Lightning Bolt}} Solutions are ready-made solutions for Experience Cloud sites to help users get started quicker
What is the difference between tasks and events?
A task is a to-do that may or may not have a due date. An event always has a duration.
What activity management features can be controlled using settings?
Shared Activities, Group Tasks, Recurrence, Activity Reminders, Multi-Day Events
Where can activities be found within Salesforce?
On the home page, calendar view or activity related-list (Salesforce Classic only) on a record
What are the different types of calendars?
User, Public Calendars and Resources
How do Group Tasks work?

A Group Task is a task that can be assigned to up to 200 users and 
Salesforce will create a separate copy of the task for each user.
When would Shared Activities be used?
When up to 50 contacts have to be related to one event or task, such as recording all of the people invited to a meeting
What can be customised with activities?
Similar to other objects, activity fields, validation rules, record types and page layouts can be customized
In Lightning Experience, where can a user find activities related to supported objects?
The Activity Timeline
Where can a list of sent emails related to a record be found?
Sent Emails are listed in the Activity History related list.
What is a Chatter feed?
A sorted list of activities (posts, comments, record updates) related to a record, group or user
What is the usage of Chatter Topics?
Allows posts to be organized. Can also be used to add topics to records. Views can use topics as a criteria.
What is Feed Tracking?

Enables a feed on selected standard and custom objects. Fields can be 
selected, so that updates to those fields will be displayed in the feed
What are Chatter groups and what are the different types?
Chatter groups allow people to collaborate; can be private, public or unlisted.
What are the different types of Chatter licenses?
Chatter Free, Chatter Only/Plus, Chatter External
What are Chatter Publisher Actions?

Actions that are available from the Chatter Feed, such as Post, File, 
New Task, Poll. Standard actions are available, custom actions can be 
defined.
What can Chatter Only users do?

They can use features including groups, files, and profiles; view 
accounts, contacts, ideas, answers, content, dashboards, reports, 
workflows, calendars; and can access to up 10 custom objects.
What is a Chatter External license used for?

Invite customers (users outside of a company’s domain) to chatter groups
 for collaboration. They have no access to Salesforce objects and data
What can be done to avoid losing long Chatter posts?
Enable Drafts in Chatter Settings
What can Chatter Free users do?
Chatter Free users can access Chatter features but have no access to tabs or data.
Which license allows users in Partner and Customer communities to access Chatter?
Lightning Platform Starter
What are repeating events called in Salesforce?
In Salesforce Classic, it is called recurring events. In Lightning Experience and Salesforce app, it is called event series.
How can users be included in a calendar event?
By using the Attendees field
What data is available in the Salesforce App?
Standard and Custom object data is available
What functionality is not available in the Salesforce app?
Some standard functionality is not available such as Account Hierarchy, merge Accounts and Contacts, manage campaign members.
What functionality related to Users is available in SalesforceA

Create new Users (iOS Only), Edit User Details, Reset Passwords, Assign 
Permission Sets, Activate, Deactivate, Unlock, Freeze, Unfreeze users, 
View Login History
What User related function cannot be done on SalesforceA?
Update Role field
Which mobile app can be integrated with a Salesforce org to allow users to share and edit documents via the Salesforce app?
Quip
Which environments are available for selection in the Outlook Integration side panel?
Production and Sandbox
Which checkbox can be selected in the Salesforce app by a user who would like Salesforce to run territory assignment rules when an account is updated and saved?
'Evaluate this account against territory rules on save' checkbox
Which related list can be accessed on an account record in the Salesforce app to view information about users in the account's territory?
'Users in Assigned Territories' related list
What are the different types of AppExchange use cases?
Generic, Functional and Industry Specific
Which Chatter feature should users use if they don't want to recieve notifications about specific posts?
Mute
What are some examples of Functional AppExchange use cases?
Sales, Marketing, Customer Service, Finance, HR
What are some examples of Generic AppExchange use cases?
Document Generation, Data Loaders, Document Signing, Email, GeoLocation
Which type of solution can be downloaded from the AppExchange to connect Salesforce to a third-party system for accpeting credit card payments?
Flow Solution
What are some examples of Industry Specific AppExchange use cases?
Healthcare and Life Sciences (Veeva), Real Estate, Education, Non Profit, Financial Services
{{c1::Cases}} are customizable records that track and manage customer support interactions, such as questions, complaints or requests.
The capabilities of case management support the case life cycle: case {{c1::creation}}, case {{c1::management}} and case {{c1::collaboration}}
Case creation includes: {{c1::manual}} case creation, {{c1::automatic}} case creation and {{c1::assignment rules}} that automate case routing to designated users or queues
Cases can be automatically created from emails sent by customers using one of two {{c1::Email-to-Case}} options: {{c1::Email-to-Case}} or {{c1::On-Demand-Email-to-Case}}
{{c1::Web-to-Case}} can be configured to allow cases to be captured through an HTML webform
An {{c1::auto-response rule}} can be set up to automatically send quick replies to customers to let them know that the company has received their case
Case {{c1::Assignment Rules}} are used to automatically assign cases to queues or users when they are created
Key fields to be familiar with on a case record: {{c1::Case number}}, {{c1::Case type}}, {{c1::Case reason}}, {{c1::Case priority}}
For merging cases a button can be clicked to merge up to {{c1::3}} duplicate cases to create one master record.
When merging cases, if the duplicate cases are kept, they will be added to the {{c1::'Merged Cases'}} related list on the master case record
Case merge can be enabled from the {{c1::Feature Settings}}→ Merge Case in Setup
{{c1::Milestones}} represent time-dependent steps in a support process. It helps agents give a consistent support service to customers.
{{c1::Knowledge}} articles can be referenced to assist in resolving a case. Example article types include FAQ’s, product manuals, processes, guidelines and tutorials
Case {{c1::Collaboration}} features include tools that allow support agents to efficiently communicate internally and externally with customers for faster resolution
A Case feed item can be marked {{c1::public}} or {{c1::private}}
Only {{c1::one}} assignment rule/s can be active,but each rule can have multiple rule entries
During case creation or update, users can tick the {{c1::Assign Using Active Assignment Rule}} checkbox before saving to assign record ownership automatically.
Email-to-Case can have attachments larger than {{c1::25Mb}}, where On-Demand-Email-to-Case can only have attachments smaller than {{c1::25Mb}}

{{c1::Roles}} need to be created first in Case Team {{c1::Roles}} setup and the level of access for each role can be determined. Level of access include: {{c2::Private}}, {{c2::Read Only}}, {{c2::Read/Write}}, and {{c2::Visible in CustomerPortal}}
{{c1::Queues}} can be used to hold cases not owned by any user.
Suggest solution: Your agents are specialized experts on different products, and you want the agent to only takes cases for their speciality.
Create case assignment rules so users specialized in computers can take all cases related to computers, the TV expert to take TV cases, etc.
Your customers are global and submit cases in different languages. You want to make sure an agent can communicate with the customer.
A case assignment rule can be set up to route cases to appropriate agents based on language. This would ensure that the right agents are able to communicate with the customers.
Suggest solution: Your customers are constantly calling to check the status of their repair case
Set up a workflow rule to email the customer of each status change, reducing the number of phone calls from customers requesting an update
Customers submit cases through email and are unsure if their email was received or when to expect a response
Set up an auto-response rule to email the customer when the submission is received and a case is created
Your company runs on a strict 5-day resolution time for cases. Any cases that have not been resolved within 3 days should be notified to a manager
Set up an escalation rule to notify a user’s manager if it is day 3 and the case has not been resolved
Cases are auto-assigned to queues. Users go into the queue and take the first case they see, working off a never-ending caseload. Your managers are concerned about older cases being ignored.
To ensure older cases aren’t ignored, set up an escalation rule to notify the queue of cases that have been in the queue and unassigned for more than 2 days

Suggest solution: Several of your incoming cases are related to billing issues and customers wanting to verify work performed. Instead of having just finance on the case and emailing out to verify information, you want to incorporate all communication in Salesforce
Build a case team that can include project managers and technicians so they can comment directly on the case feed or reply to the customer themselves

Many cases involve customers requesting product enhancements or asking when new features will be released. Your support agents don’t have the knowledge to resolve on their own and often reach out to the product managers and developers for assistance
Create case teams for each product line, including the product managers and developers, so they can provide you with the correct answer to give the customer.

Your customers mention the long wait times when calling in for service. You already have a well-developed company website and want to find a way to allow customers to submit support requests via the company website
Web-to-Case can generate HTML which can be placed on your company website. Customers can then submit support requests from your website which will create cases automatically

Your company has a support email that customers use to request support. You are spending a lot of time transferring the contents of emails and creating cases in Salesforce to manage the support requests
Set up email-to-case, so users can simply email in issues and cases are created automatically
What is a case process?
A case process is a support process that defines the stages different cases may go through in their life cycle
When would you use case comments vs the case feed
When you want to track comments made by customers, not just internal comments
What can you get in case settings?
Default case owner, notifications and when they are sent, and templates used for notifications
What are some case key fields?
Case Key Fields include Status to define where in the life cycle the case is, Case Type, Case Reason, Case Priority, and Case Origin
What are the ways cases can be captured in Saleforce?

Cases can be manually created by users onto a Case record page, or be automatically captured when admins set up Web-to-Case, Email-to-Case or On-Demand Email-to-Case. Customers may create cases from a Community, Customer Portal, Self-Service Portal, or Chatter Answers
What are the case automation tools available?
Case Queues, Auto Response Rules, Escalation Rules, Assignment Rules, Macros
What is the purpose of case teams?
Case teams are set up so users can take on predefined roles and work together to close a case
Which app can be created to help case agents to manage multiple case records on a single screen in Salesforce
Service Console app
Which Salesforce features can be used in an email to a customer by a support agent in order to improve efficiency?
Email Template, Quick Text, and Merge Fields
What can be made required for Web-to-Case to ensure that irrelevant or unwanted cases are not generated?
reCAPTCHA Verification
There are two main methods of mass updating or importing data in Salesforce: {{c1::Data Import Wizard}} and {{c2::Data Loader}}

The data import wizard is available to {{c1::end users}} and {{c1::admins}}. It is available in the setup menu and can import only with a limit of {{c2::50000}} records. {{c3::Validation rules}} and {{c3::triggers}} will fire, but {{c3::workflows}} rule execution is optional.

Data loader is only available to {{c1::admins}}. The {{c2::data loader app}} needs to be installed on your computer and it can load up to {{c3::5 million}} records. Workflow rules, validation rules and triggers will fire.
In the {{c1::data import wizard}} you can choose to find duplicates, but this is not possible in {{c1::data loader}}.

Data validation tools are used to ensure accurate data is entered into Salesforce by way of {{c1::validation rules}} that ensure that what is acceptable as new or updated data meets the conditions set. There are two types of rules: {{c2::system}} validation and {{c2::custom}} validation.
System validation rules include {{c1::required fields}} and {{c1::unique fields}}
Condition and error message are specified for a validation rule. When the condition formula is {{c1::true}}, the error is displayed.
{{c1::Validation rules}} are enforced prior to any other processing rules, Workflows or Processes

For multiple Workflow Rules triggered simultaneously, the order in which individual actions and types of actions are executed is not guaranteed by Salesforce. However, {{c1::field update}} actions are executed first, followed by other actions.
What order of execution is triggered whenever a record is inserted, updated, or upserted?

Very = Validation Rules
Awesome = Assignment Rules
Admins = Auto-Response Rules
Want = Workflow Rules
Exciting = Escalation Rules
Projects = Process Builder

Daily limit of {{c1::1,000}} emails can be sent from email alerts per Salesforce license per organization. Daily limit of {{c1::2,000,000}} emails can be sent organization wide. When the daily allocation limit for email alerts has been reached, any emails in the workflow queue left over will not be sent and will be {{c1::discarded}} the day after.
For workflow rules, a formula can reference merge fields on the same record or related records up to {{c1::10}} levels away

Outbound messages send data from an object to an external system. Data from specified fields are sent in {{c1::XML}} format via an API message. Outbound message is used to send SOAP message to a web URL endpoint. Requires the receiver to have a {{c1::web service listening}}.
You can have up to {{c1::50}} versions of a flow
What are the three workflow evaluation criteria options that determine when workflow rules are evaluated?

- When a record is created
- When it is created and every time it is edited
- When a record is created and any time it is edited to then meet the evaluation criteria
What are the capabilities of an approval process?
Define a series of steps and actions for approving selected standard and custom objects that meet certain criteria.
What options does an approver have for responding to a request?
Approve, Reject or Reassign
What are some use cases for approval processes?
Approval of Quotes/Contracts, PTO, Expense Reports, Overtime, Deadline Extensions, Discounts, Funding and Purchasing
What actions are possible with Process Builder?
Create or update records, invoke a quick action, submit a record for approval, post to Chatter, send an email, invoke a flow, invoke
When must Workflow be used and not Process Builder?
When needing to send outbound messages
What are the two main types of flows in Flow Builder?
Screen flows and Autolaunched flows
What are the three running modes in flows?
User or System context, System Context with Sharing, and System Context without Sharing
What are the actions supported by approval processes?
email alerts, task creation, field updates, and outbound messages
Which automation tools support sending of outbound messages?
workflow and approvals
How can workflow rules be evaluated?
If certain criteria is met or if a formula evaluates to true
When are workflow actions executed?
Either immediately or after a number of days or hours from a date field or trigger date
What type of actions can be set for approval or rejection?
Create Task, Send Emails, Field Update or Send Outbound Message
Where can an approver see the pending request and respond to it?
On the Record, on the Homepage, Respond to Email, in App Notifications, Chatter
What are the steps to define a process in the Process Builder?
Define the object, define the criteria, select immediate or scheduled actions, activate the process
In what cases would Process Builder be used over Workflow?
When needing to create a record, submit for approval or launch a flow
Which automation tools allow sending an automatic email alert to a user when a new member is added to a Chatter group?
Workflow Rule and Process Builder
What are the different types of autolaunched flows?
Record-triggered flows, Platform event-triggered flows, Schedule-triggered flows, Autolaunched flows (no trigger)
What element in Flow Builder can be used to execute a certain path if a criteria is met?
Decision element
What are the different stages in an approval process?
initial submission, final approval, final rejection, recall
Which automation tool is capable of deleting records?
Flow Builder

fields: An app's logo and navigation bar color can be changed under {{c1::'App Manager'}} in Setup.
The apps that appear in the Lightning Experience App Launcher can be changed under {{c1::'App Menu'}} in Setup.
The {{c1::Lightning App Builder}} can be used to create, customize and assign home pages to different profiles in Lightning Experience.
The {{c1::List view search bar}} can be used to search records from within the Kanban view in Lightning Experience.
{{c1::Sharing Settings}} can be selected from the List View Controls menu to share a custom list view with other users.
Access to reports and dashboards are determined by the access level to the {{c1::folders}} in which they are contained. Access level can be defined for a particular user, group, territory, or role.

Sales Reps have informed their Admin that they would like to edit their oportunities directly inline in the list view without having to load each record individually. Which user interface settings can the Admin change to meet this request?
Inline Editing & Enhanced lists. If only "Inline Editing" is enabled, records can be edited inline in a record detail page, but not in a list view.
Users have complained that the Account screen is taking a long time to load. What could the Admin do to address this?
Enable separate loading of related lists.
